summary: Presenting oneself as flawless can provoke envy and animosity from others. It is wise to reveal harmless flaws and vulnerabilities to foster relatability and diminish envy. The case of Joe Orton and Kenneth Halliwell illustrates how unchecked envy can lead to catastrophic outcomes. Orton’s success intensified Halliwell’s feelings of inferiority, ultimately culminating in tragic violence. The chapter highlights strategies to navigate the treacherous waters of envy by balancing one's successes with humility and imperfection.

slides.section_body: Striving for an image of perfection can be perilous. Those who present themselves as faultless may unintentionally foster feelings of envy in others around them. Acknowledging one’s flaws can serve to defuse hostility and make one more relatable.
slides.quote: Only gods and the dead can seem perfect with impunity.

slides.section_body: Joe Orton's rise to fame reveals how talents can provoke envy. Despite initial collaborations with Kenneth Halliwell, Orton's singular success highlighted Halliwell's insecurities. The shift in their dynamics represents the toxic impact of growing envy.

Revealing minor weaknesses can soften the harshness of envy. Displaying humility and admitting to petty flaws can transform perceptions, allowing others to relate to our humanity rather than resent our accomplishments.
slides.quote: It takes great talent and skill to conceal one’s talent and skill.

slides.section_body: Success can alienate friends and peers, fueling envy rather than admiration. Those who thrive in their pursuits must remain sensitive to the feelings of those left behind, as their victories can unknowingly deepen rifts.
slides.quote: Once success happens your way, the people to fear the most are those in your own circle.

slides.section_body: The tragic culmination of Orton and Halliwell's relationship underscores the destructive power of envy. When envy is left unacknowledged, it can lead to heartbreaking hostility, demonstrating the dire consequences of unchecked emotions.
slides.quote: Envy torments those who harbor it.

slides.section_body: Envy is a complex emotion often disguised as critique or excessive praise. Recognizing these subtle signs can help mitigate its effects and allow one to navigate social dynamics more effectively.
slides.quote: The envious hides as carefully as the secret, lustful sinner.

slides.section_body: Choosing to present oneself humbly, even in success, can diffuse envy. By sharing credit and attributing success to luck rather than skill, one can both downplay their brilliance and earn admiration.
slides.quote: Expect that when people envy you they will work against you insidiously.

slides.section_body: Creating an atmosphere of goodwill through generosity can stave off bitterness. Giving support to others and lifting them can transform destructive competition into a mutual uplifting experience.
slides.quote: Don’t try to help those who envy you; they will think you are condescending.

slides.section_body: Being aware of the dynamics of envy among peers is crucial. In environments where equal status is perceived, it is often those closest who may harbor feelings of resentment.
slides.quote: Envy is the tax which all distinction must pay.

slides.section_body: The best revenge against envy is to thrive regardless. Those who rise above the noise of envy prove that power does not always stem from conflict; it often thrives in the shadows of humility and strength.
slides.quote: The fool dares the gods of envy by flaunting his victories.
